org.netbeans.modules.bugtracking.spi

Class IssueScheduleInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.netbeans.modules.bugtracking.spi.IssueScheduleInfo

  • public final class IssueScheduleInfo
extends Object
    Represents the date period for which an Issue is scheduled. This can be one specific day as well an interval of days given then by a beginning date and an amount of days.
    Since:
    1.85

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      IssueScheduleInfo(Date date)
      Creates a IssueScheduleInfo representing one specific day for which an Issue is scheduled to start to work on it.
      IssueScheduleInfo(Date startDate, int interval)
      Creates a IssueScheduleInfo representing one or more days for which an Issue is scheduled to start to work on it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Compares two instances of IssueSchedulingInfo.
      Date getDate()
      Returns the beginning date of the time period when the work on a Issue should start.
      int getInterval()
      Determines for how many days an issue was scheduled.

      Builds a hash code for this instance created from the values of date and interval, i.e.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IssueScheduleInfo

        public IssueScheduleInfo(Date date)
        Creates a IssueScheduleInfo representing one specific day for which an Issue is scheduled to start to work on it.
        Parameters:
        date -
        Since:
        1.85

      • IssueScheduleInfo

        public IssueScheduleInfo(Date startDate,
                         int interval)
        Creates a IssueScheduleInfo representing one or more days for which an Issue is scheduled to start to work on it.
        Parameters:
        startDate - determines the day from which this issue is scheduled
        interval - determines for how many days an issue is scheduled. Allowed values are >=1.
        Since:
        1.85

    • Method Detail

      • getDate

        public Date getDate()
        Returns the beginning date of the time period when the work on a Issue should start. In case an Issue is scheduled for more than one day, then this would be the starting date.
        Returns:
        the beginning date
        Since:
        1.85

      • getInterval

        public int getInterval()
        Determines for how many days an issue was scheduled. Obviously then, 1 stands for one day given by the start date - getDate().
        Returns:
        the interval in days
        Since:
        1.85

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Object obj)
        Compares two instances of IssueSchedulingInfo. This instance equals to the other object if the other object is an IssueSchedulingInfo and both date and interval (values returned by getDate() and getInterval()) are equal for both the instances.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        obj - another object to compare.
        Returns:
        true if the two objects are equal.
        Since:
        1.85

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Builds a hash code for this instance created from the values of date and interval, i.e. values returned by getDate() and getInterval().
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object
        Returns:
        hash code
        Since:
        1.85
